Title: Disney‚Äôs Snow White | Official Trailer | In Theaters March 21
Description:
Magic mirror on the wall, show us the story that started it all. 

Watch the official trailer for Disney‚Äôs #SnowWhite, only in theaters March 21, 2025.

From the producer and executive producer of ‚ÄúWicked,‚Äù Marc Platt and Jared LeBoff, and director Marc Webb (‚ÄúThe Amazing Spider-Man‚Äù) comes ‚ÄúDisney‚Äôs Snow White,‚Äù a live-action musical reimagining of the studio‚Äôs classic 1937 film. The magical music adventure journeys back to the timeless story with Rachel Zegler (‚ÄúWest Side Story‚Äù) in the title role and Gal Gadot (‚ÄúWonder Woman‚Äù) as her Stepmother, the Evil Queen.
  
The new trailer showcases the scale and beauty of the lavish production design, the beloved characters Bashful, Doc, Dopey, Grumpy, Happy, Sleepy, and Sneezy, and a first look at the power ballad Waiting on a Wish, one of the all-new original songs from EGOT winners Benj Pasek and Justin Paul (‚ÄúThe Greatest Showman‚Äù).

Comments.author: @neco5897
Comments.text:
If diversity is truly important, all countries and cultures should be treated equally. However, discussions often focus only on white and black representation, while Asian and other cultures are overlooked in movies and animation.  
Diversity should aim for fairness for everyone, but in reality, only certain groups are prioritized, while others are barely explored and are treated superficially in entertainment media.  
In the end, the term "diversity" is often used as an excuse for self-satisfaction and personal agendas, rather than achieving true equality.  

Destroying the image that fans cherish and forcing diversity in a way that hurts them is a form of violence.  
Diversity should bring happiness to everyone, but when it is imposed, it only creates more unhappiness.  
People need to take a step back and think‚Äîwhat is diversity really for?  

In the same series, a new princess with different skin or hair color can be introduced in a separate title. Isn't that already a wonderful way to embrace diversity?  

Values should never be forced upon others.  
It‚Äôs not just about appearance‚Äîsome people love the idea of waiting for a prince like the classic princesses, some want to go on a journey to find their prince, and some don‚Äôt need a prince at all.  
Accepting all of these perspectives is what true diversity should be.  

Saying "this is how it should be" is just another form of violence.  
There will always be people who suffer when something is forced upon them.  

I feel that creating new works that respect the original story, the source material, and diverse races and cultures is a wonderful way to embrace true representation. But what do you think?
